titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Flatlands land patents and military commission 1974.016
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:17:10 +0000.

did.unittitle: Flatlands land patents and military commission

physdesc.extent: in two folders in one oversize box.

did.abstract: Two land patents issued by colonial New York Governors Richard Nicolls and Thomas Dongan, dating from 1667 and 1685, for the Town of Amersfort (Flatlands) in Kings County. Also included is a commission of appointment to the Kings County Militia issued to Nicholas Schenk of Gravesend, dated 1787.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Gift of Mrs. L.B. Peters, date unknown. Formally accessioned in 1974.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Flatlands land patents and military commission, 1974.016, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.
